title: Effectiveness Analysis and Application Strategies for e-Learning in Engineering Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic engineering mathematics concepts and experience with digital learning tools
context.additional_context: Post-COVID-19 Analysis of E-Learning Impact in Engineering Education: Need for Effective Learning Strategies in Limited Smartphone-Based Online Environments, with Focus on Theoretical Mathematics and Conceptual Understanding Over Practical Skills

learning_goals: The effectiveness of engineering math learning in e-learning environments can be evaluated by comparing online/offline outcomes based on criteria such as knowledge improvement, skill acquisition, and social competence.
Identify three major barriers to e-learning in smartphone-based limited-technology environments and propose improvement strategies.
Design core components of a hybrid learning model considering the sustainability of engineering education post-pandemic.

resources: Simple online quiz tools (e.g., Google Forms)
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
